noun.description: The action or practice of inflicting severe pain on someone as a punishment or to force them to do or say something, or for the pleasure of the person inflicting the pain.

examples: most of the victims had been brutally tortured

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense distortion, twisting, or a physical disorder characterized by this): via French from late Latin tortura twisting, torment, from Latin torquere to twist.
